result.execSummary:
The defendant Gualbert Portillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
*  Pay fine of $1,000.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not have contact with drug dealers or felons, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not have contact with drug dealers or felons, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  CONSECUTIVE to Racine case 14CF1593 and Milwaukee case 18CF3791.

superMiscConds.notes: May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  May not have contact with known drug felons, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt: 8/3/2015 - Sentencing hearing
Bond applied; partial refund.  kk/cp   ck# 15CH074664
Associated with Charge #2
Associated with Charge #1
from Defendant
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Bowe.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Statement from Wanda R.  On ct 1 the court imposes a total sentence of 21 months WSP; 15 months initial confinement w/credit for 9 days served; 6 months extended supervision w/conditions; $1,000 fine plus costs; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; on ct 2 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 4 years w/conditions, consecutive to ct 1; deft to pay $500 DNA surcharge, bond applied to fine/costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Bowe.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 2.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 2.  PSI ordered (court does not oppose Judge Gasioraiewicz being provided a copy of the PSI from this file); DNA sample ordered.  SEH 8/3/15 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial on June 2, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
from Atty Bowe
Atty Bowe is in trial in Racine on another matter and therefore the FPT of 5/1/15 at 8:15am is rescheduled to 6/2/15 at 1:15pm.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Chernin, for Atty A Bowe.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court notes that the minutes from the last hearing indicate the case is likely to be resolved.  ADA Delgado states that she did not agree to joinder of case w/Racine case, has not spoken with Atty Bowe.  FPT continued to 5/1/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.
from Atty Bowe
With Pat/Atty Bowe and by approval of the court, the FPT of 2/19/15 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, as Atty Bowe is in trial in Milwaukee; reset to 3/13/15 at 11:30am.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Bowe.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Bowe states the deft was charged in Racine for same course of conduct and she would like to discuss possible consolidation of cases w/ADA in Racine; beleives this case is likely to be resolved.  FPT continued to 2/19/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Spoke with Pat/Atty Bowe and advised her the deft has until the end of the day to go to jail to sign the bond or a warrant will be issued.
Judge wants $5,000 bond signed by close of today's business by defendant. msg w/his attorney.  (Bond may be signed in 204 also)
Left message w/sec. for Atty Ann Bowe that client needs to come to Kenosha to sign correct $5,000 bond or judge will issue warrant for $10,000 if not signed.

346.04(3) -Attempting To Flee or Elude Traffice Officer   941.30(2) -2nd Degree Recklessly Endagering Safety

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Ann Bowe. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Bowe and by co-def. Tab pulled for Judge Wagner. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. DAPT on 12-19-14 @ 1:30pm. Judicial pretrial on 1-9-15 @ 8:30am. Atty. Bowe has filed bond motion and argues for bond modification. Bond modified to $5000 cash with the following conditions: Not to possess or consume alcohol. Not to possess or consume controlled substances without a prescription. Not to drive a motor vehicle at all. No discussion of this case with Diana R. or Kimberly T. No contact with Jonathan P. or his residence.
